description: Chatpate is a delightful and vibrant street food from Nepal, offering a burst of flavors and textures in every bite. This recipe captures the essence of classic chatpate, focusing on puffed rice, fresh vegetables, and a tangy sauce.

ingredients.name: Green chilies
ingredients.qty: 1 tablespoon, chopped (adjust to your spice preference)

steps: Prepare the Vegetables: Boil the potato and cut it into small cubes. Chop the tomato, onion, cucumber, green chilies, and coriander leaves.

Make the Sauce: In a small bowl, combine lemon juice, black salt, cumin powder, red chili powder, and water. Stir well to create a tangy sauce. Adjust the water content for your desired consistency. You can add chopped mint leaves or a tablespoon of yogurt for a richer flavor (optional).
Assemble the Chatpate: In a large serving bowl, combine the puffed rice, cubed potato, chopped vegetables (tomato, onion, cucumber, green chilies), and chopped peanuts.
Pour the Sauce: Drizzle the prepared sauce over the chatpate mixture. Toss gently to ensure everything is evenly coated.
Garnish and Serve: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. You can also add a sprinkle of sev, boondi, or papri for additional texture and flavor. Serve immediately and enjoy the burst of flavors!
